name: The Cumberland

reviews.text: We stayed at the Cumberland for one night on Friday 30th June and were on the whole very pleased with the experience.
reviews.title: Comfortable and well located

reviews.text: The hotel reception is impressive, with multicolour 'mood lighting' and some interesting artworks. Checking in was slow but as per other reviews, I put this down to a sluggish computer system rather than sluggish staff. Our room was booked incorrectly as a twin and the change to a double room was no problem.
reviews.title: Not bad - great location

reviews.text: The room itself had a modern feel, however did not appear hugely different from your average London hotel room. The flat screen television was impressive but would have been better if the supposedly digital reception was tuned in corrently. The glass door to the bathroom looked nice however did feel a touch too clinical for our taste. The bed was comfortable, the room quiet and the air conditioning welcome and effective.
reviews.title: fabulous hotel in central London

reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is its location. Situated a few seconds walk from Marble Arch at one end of Hyde Park, you're within walking distance of Knightsbridge and perfectly positioned should you be visiting London for one of the many concerts held in the park.
reviews.title: dull breakfast - great room + quiet
Bad service, never staying here again
reviews.text: We would definitely make a return visit and would recommend anyone looking for a well-located hotel to give the Cumberland a try.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through lastminute.com as one of their Top Secret Hotels. This made the hotel cheaper than normal, and did not mind paying the amount we did but would not pay any more.
reviews.title: Good... Nothing Special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the hotel for the [rice and location (As we knew the rough location even though it was 'Secret'). The location is about a two minute stroll to Marble Arch and jut off Oxford Street for all the major shops, and high end designers are just off Oxford Street, so shopping is well catered for. The lobby is very nice. Good, simple design, set off by good lighting and cool features. Some people have complained about shabby hallways, althought they did not seem that bad to us. The rooms themselves were small but adequately sized for a weekend away. The decor was nice, but our room looked different from some of the photos reviews on this site. We think that it is currently being renovated though so this maybe why our bathroom especially was not very modern, but everything was clean and worked well. It is a big hotel, so it is obviously going to take a while to renovate.
reviews.title: great lobby, reception staff rude, corridors awful

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel was good for the price we paid, but would not pay more and probably would look elsewhere again, but purely because we like to try new hotels unless they are amazing.
reviews.title: Underwhelming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend Prezzo across the road. Really modern little Italian with great food and good atmosphere.
reviews.title: Great Location and good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for newyears eve night and me and my partner were very disappointed. So disappointed even the location cannot redeem the hotel. The gir lwho checked us in at the reception was rude.
reviews.title: It's all about the location

reviews.text: Spent a single night here on business - I was impressed on arrival, very well received and greeted. Was able to walk to Oxford street for a meal but had breakfast in the hotel which was top drawer.
reviews.title: New to this hotel, hope to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was small, but hey, this is London!
reviews.title: Smoke and Mirrors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel a few months ago with a deal through Travelzoo. We were staying for my husbands birthday as convenient for the Royal Albert Hall where we were watching a show. Location is great for Oxford Street!
reviews.title: Great location and good Rhodes restaurant.
So convenient BUT dreadful to the senses
reviews.text: When I first looked at the pictures on the website, i thought it was too good to be true...it was.

On arrival, first impressions were great, doormen to open our taxi and direct us to reception. Then this is where it went downhill. The check in was fairly impersonal and seemed very slow, 10 minutes just to check our name and give us a key with barely a word said. Then we were handed our room keys to be told to go out the building, turn right, walk 10 seconds to another building where our executive room was.
reviews.title: Grotty Rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a week's stay at the Cumberland during London's record-setting heatwave. Lobby as cool, restful and contemporary as other reviewers have mentioned. However, at no time during our stay did we find it smokey, as another reviewer mentioned. As a matter of fact, I never smelled smoke during our entire stay. Like other reviewers, however, we arrived after 2pm from a long flight to find that our room was not ready--we were asked to wait 30 minutes and exactly 30 minutes later we were in our room.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay at the Cumberland

likes.disliked: — heavily catered to Middle Eastern clientele

reviews.text: Room was very small(even by British standards), but clean, well-maintained and comfortable. Fine for 2 people. Iron, ironing board, hair dryer (I found it convenient in it's location outside the bathroom), safe and fridge in the room. Very slick and contemporary bathroom, but short on space for toiletries, also had to make multiple requests each day for extra towels as we needed to freshen up after the heat of London and the tubes. At first the A/C was not working adequately given the excessive heat in London, but after 2 requests, the A/C was fixed to our satisfaction.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — Rooms - lovely colours, bright, fresh and everything you need
likes.disliked: — Access from Oxford Street / Marble Arch

reviews.title: Stay away from the Cumberland
reviews.text: Everyone at this hotel very friendly, very helpful--especially the concierge desk. Like another reviewer, we were referred to Porte Des Indes (Passage to India) and it was one of the best meals I have had in 3 trips to London. Definitely worth the walk around the block. Three blocks away is a good Spanish tapas restaurant La Tasca, and a little further on, La Rueda--which we make sure to visit every time we are in London (excellent paella). Also try Taman Gang, across the street from the tube station (Marble Arch) on Park Lane. They are expensive, but serve excellent Thai fusion cuisine in a romantic, candle lit "Thai temple" setting. This is a great area for restaurants.

As other reviewers have stated, having Pret Manger just outside the hotel is a great convenience for inexpensive snacks and sandwiches. There are two ATMs nearby: one across the street and another one block further down Oxford Street at Sainsbury (also good for water, snacks--and the ONLY place we found selling Pepsi!).
reviews.title: Really enjoyed our stay
Great value, great location
reviews.text: Althought this is a terrific location, at the risk of political incorrectness, I would warn the American traveller that this area of town is also called "Londinistan", and my experience is that I was one of only 3 or 4 female guests at the hotel (which was at full capacity) not completely covered and veiled. The tube entrance and this block was packed with Muslim prostletizers, which was intimidating , especially when I was not accompanied by my husband. The traveller will not have an "English" experience at this hotel. It did not seem to be an international hotel, but very definitely caters to the middle eastern visitor.That being said, every guest at the hotel was considerate and polite.
We booked a 2 night stay in june this year through Expedia. Great deal !
reviews.title: Location, location !

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is really a huge plus when visiting London. We know this city well and being near Marble arch is a must for any tourist activities. To me, marble arch is the true center of London. Lots of tube and bus connections, shopping locations, park are nearby.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: The check in was fast and pro. We had our room right away.
reviews.title: No problems
fine hotel
reviews.text: The hotel : The lobby is sooooo cool. The style is modern so if don't like sharp forms don't stay there ! Very nice relaxing atmosphere indeed when you enter in.

The room was small but very clean. The view from the room was hideous (it wasn't a street view). Bed was ok. Funny things : the hairdryer is outside the bathroom! The shower is large but hard to adjust and the water was dripping ouside of it. The flat screen TV is neat but needed some tune up to have a good reception.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: We booked this on line via an internet site way in advance. I emailed the hotel once to ask to ensure we were allocated a TWIN room. No reply. A few days before arriving I emailed them again and received a reply after checking in. The reply said we have been allocated a twin room. Meanwhile, at check in we were told by the agent that there are no twin rooms and we would have to pay 90 pounds extra to get an upgrade to a larger room which was SUITE LIKE with two beds. Weird. Not wanting to pay 90 pounds we took the room they gave us. Small, on the first floor and not the type of place you wish to spend a lot of time. It was a twin and not the one they said they had put aside. The agent made out she found this one as a last resort and it had not been previously allocated. Be very careful when dealing with this business via email. They do not appear to have good follow up and internal communication
reviews.title: Customer service flaws

reviews.text: We stayed there Fri to Monday. I didn't see what all the hype about the hotel is about. The rooms was so small and I particularly didn't like the shower. The dials was hard to turn, and the water fell out on the bathroom floor when we took a shower because there was no shower curtain or door. ...That' a bit to comtemporary for me. When we called to enquire about this they said, we are supposed to keep the bathroom door open against the shower opening!!! Further, the blinds in the open room area was dusty.
reviews.title: Ok with a push
Really like this place.
reviews.text: They had a lovely plasma tv but the channels was so limited most of the channels was non-english speaking stations and every BBC station possible. The movie choices wasnt all that either. But I liked the internet option on the TV. The room was so small, with no real space to move around. I wondered if all their rooms was like that but we didint bother to move because we were going to Paris on a one day excursion the next day and would only be in the room for a limited time. But if I was looking for relaxing place to stay, I wouldn't choose there.
The bar in the lobby is so expensive...go to a pub around the corner for better prices.
reviews.title: Very funky hotel in a great location, bad room

reviews.text: However, the hotel is an excellent location! So, if you looking for somewhere where it is easy to move around...here is the place, but the cost is kinda high unless you get a special on expedia or so.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Fantastic location, It is a few minutes walk around the corner to the local tube station. However, it is extremelly busy around the hotel due to its position.
reviews.title: Reasonable Hotel for London

reviews.text: Not the quickest check-in I have encountered, and had to keep asking the reception desk to repeat things as their English was not the best.
reviews.title: What a Suprise

reviews.text: The hotel Lobby, depending on your taste, is interesting. The rooms were clean and compact, I had everything I needed to hand.
reviews.title: Expensive hotel, bad service and so much noise

reviews.text: The breakfast was fantastic, one of the best I have encountered in London, with various stations serving a variety of foodstuffs from around the world. Loved it Never got to try out the Rhodes Restaurant.
reviews.title: Decent hotel if you can get a good price

reviews.text: The drinks in the hotel bar were very expensive, so we just had one drink and ventured out to find more reasonable priced establishments, and there were many.....
reviews.title: Great Hotel...Great Location...OK Staff

reviews.text: First Impressions-wise, The Cumberland looks great. Understand that the hotel underwent a recent refurbishment & they went for a cool, modern chic look with art installations and designer furniture making up the expansive lobby area. Must agree that you'll hardly find seating space in the lobby area though, usually filled with guests and at a glance, you'll understand what a previous reviewer meant by "Londonistan".
reviews.title: Service faults The Cumberland

reviews.text: Will go into the pluses first. Contrary to what some of the reviewers say, I actually find the rooms spacious (we had a triple room though), but then again I'm of the typical petite asian built. Decor-wise, pleasing, with continuation of the minimalist, cool modern chic look. Rooms sufficiently equipped with tv, internet options, fridge, hairdryer, ironing board, clean bathroom and check this out - molton brown toiletries.
reviews.title: Poor value at the Cumberland

reviews.text: Breakfast is actually a decent spread with a buffet set-up offering english breakfast, variety of cereals, fruits, juices & toasts. Coffee sucks though, but you can request for Nescafe coffee mixes from the servers.
reviews.title: Crappy Cumberland, Gutted At Guoman

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And of course, the location is unbeatable. 1 min from Marble Arch tube & if you walk down the stretch, you're along the shopping stretch of Oxford street, Bond street. Stone's throw from Hyde Park too.
reviews.title: disappointed

likes.disliked: — Small room, works style breakfast room

reviews.text: And for Singaporeans out there who are reading this review, SQ checks their crew into The Cumberland too. Which usually says alot about the hotel as the crew usually stays in some of the best hotels in town. While I can see how The Cumberland can appear from the facade as a top-notch & possibly has the potential to be one, it fails in one glaringly important aspect - service.
reviews.title: great, great, great

reviews.text: We stayed at The Cumberland in November and got an excellent rate that represented value for money via laterooms.co.uk The room was very nice and clean and there was very little noise. The entrance to the hotel is impressive but we didn't see anything else of the hotel as we chose to eat out. it is right next to Marble Arch tube station so it is ideal for getting around. There are plenty of pubs and shops to have breakfast, lunch, dinner and drinks. It is on the corner of Hyde Park so is also ideal to go for a walk to get away from the hussle and bussle. Overall a great stay. We tried to stay again in December but it was virtually double the rate so we chose to stay elsewhere much to our dissapointment.
reviews.title: Great central location and ideal for getting about

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I felt that we got a good deal with the Cumberland. The location was excellent because our main purpose for being in central London was shopping and it was a five minute walk from Selfridges and Oxford Street. It's true that once you get past the amazing lobby, the corridors look very shabby. However our room was spotless and very comfortable but very small! Also some of the design features of the bathroom weren't very practical. I have to say the thing that stood out the most to me was....no MINIBAR in the room. Yes, finally a hotel that doesn't bother with a stupid mini fridge crammed with extortionately priced drinks and treats that you can just stare at and salivate over (god forbid you actually touch anything or dare to remove it for more than a millisecond or you'll get zapped with charges). Instead we had an EMPTY FRIDGE so we could stock up on snacks and drinks ourselves at the Tescos or Marks and Spencers just round the corner at a fraction of the minibar prices. Kudos to the Cumberland for providing this fridge, I wish more hotels would do this. We got a very good deal for this hotel on a website and felt we made the right choice.
reviews.title: We were pleased with the Cumberland
Average
reviews.text: This is a expensive hotel in a very expensive city. I would at best rate my stay here as average. The staff was ok, however without a smile. The high point of the hotel is its location. The rooms were ok, however lots of scope of improvement. The rooms are quite small and not squeaky clean. Also, there is noise in the lobby. I would stay here again only if the price is right.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a good reputation and it certainly lived up to it. The rooms were well furnished and comfortable, with all you would need for a mini break. The only down side was the very long wait to check out, but they did say it wasnt normal.
reviews.title: good hotel and very central

reviews.text: Being next to the main road of london, the rooms are surprisingly cozy and quite. the interior is decorated with an edgy touch, while the exterior remains grand and historical. great stay, only problem I had was that the rooms were fairly crowded with furnitures, but understandable in a city with limited space
reviews.title: Decent stay

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for a shopping trip at Easter 2006, getting a good price on-line. We both much prefer contemporary to traditional London chintzy hotels, and the Cumberland seemed to fit the bill. We weren't disappointed but we weren't thrilled either. On the plus side, the service was first class - all the stuff were very friendly - and the location is simply amazing - just at the top of Oxford Street. On the downside, whillst the room was clean and modern it was a little characterless (like a fancy Travelodge, really) and it didnt have a DVD or CD player, which is a bit disappointing at this price. The bathroom too was clean but unspectacular, with a few chips off the bath, very few toileteries, and no bathrobes. All in all, if you can get it for a bargain then its a great base for the weekend, but if you are paying full price then there are better 4 and 5 star hotels in London.
reviews.title: Good service, great location

reviews.text: I've stayed at the Cumberland Hotel twice in four months and really like it. Stayed at the St. Martin's Lane (known for its "ambience) near Covent Garden and it was twice the price and the rooms were a lot smaller.
reviews.title: Love it
very nice designer hotel but costy
reviews.text: The location (Marble Arch) can't be beat. AND when you reserve online, you can secure rooms for 99GBP. That's virtually unheard of for hotels in London these days, especially onces with fairly large rooms and HUGE flat screen TVs.
The service can be a bit spotty, given the size of the hotel (800 rooms; largest in London), but the price and size and comfort of the rooms, makes up for it. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but be careful
Good, but expensive
reviews.text: Generally very good but I suppose this is what is expected for that price. We were put in a room on the third floor first, quite small and everything else was just like all other standard hotels apart from the air-con and plasma tv. We were a bit disappointed as there was nothing as special/artistic/contemporary as was advertised, but the room was tidy, clean and well appointed. As we left the room we found that the adjacent rooms were undergoing refurbishment, we expressed our concern about the possible noise in the morning at the reception and so they let us change to a room on another floor. The second room was amazing; everything, from interior to coffee mugs are 'designer stuff'. Air-con means a very quiet room even situated in busy area. Bed is clean and comfy. Excellent.
I stayed for 2 nights at the Cumberland Hotel and to be frank was not amused.
reviews.title: Trendy and modern but rude and not for me!

reviews.text: The reception area while large and clean is full of art deco and strange sculptures that I found just weird!
reviews.title: More than expected

reviews.text: I checked in at 3pm and like someone else who wrote a review here, my room was not ready so we waited in the bar for 45 minutes. At about £4 for a beer and an automatic service charge of 12.5% I wish we'd found somewhere else. When we went back to check-in we were told rather rudely to go to the back of the queue, despite being told we could go striaght to the desk. I complained to another member of staff and didn't even get an apology!
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.text: So after queueing for another 20 minutes we got our room! The only good things I have to say about it are that the bed was very comfortable, the air conditioning worked and the flat screen tv was pretty cool.
reviews.title: Good central london hotel

reviews.text: There was no bath, despite requesting one, no soap, the room was ridiculously small, the minibar was not stocked (they actually charge you just to stock it) and the phone didn't work!
reviews.title: Modernist Chic
Small, Funky Rooms, but Great Location
reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Cumberland in August 2005, and we had a so-so experience with the hotel, but a lovely experience with the area. The major con was the small space. We had considerable trouble finding a place to unpack our suitcases. Of course, you have to take into account that European rooms are smaller, but it didn't feel like the space was maximized. The decor is seriously funky. For us, that wasn't a large problem, but it definitely could be for others--this isn't an Edwardian palace. That said, the staff was very kind in helping us switch rooms when we complained and in making dinner arangements. But if you're looking solely for location, this is your place. Located right next to the Tube station, the Cumberland makes travel in hectic London a breeze. We rode to and from a variety of places like the Britsh Museum and St. Paul's. It's also located within walking distance of Kensington and Knightsbridge for the world-class shopping.

reviews.title: Not That Great
reviews.text: I stayed at the Cumberland for the May bank holiday weekend 2006. Impressed by the reviews on Trip Advisor I spent a little more than I would have liked to stay in what looked like a really fab and funky hotel, bang in the center of London.

When we arrived there was an unreal queue to check in, even thought it was 4pm in the afternoon. Although check in is from 2pm, our room wasn't ready so we had to wait half and queue again... not even a system in place to avoid us having to go back in the queue. We weren't even offered a drink while we waited, which you'd at least expect in a four star hotel.
reviews.title: Check In was appalling

reviews.text: Anyway we found a nice pub a block away and had a beer there, then made our way back. Our room was nothing like what they advertise on the internet. It did have a plasma screen, and that was about the only thing it had in common with the rooms I'd seen when doing my research.
reviews.title: Reasonably Priced Weekend Break
Nice hotel with great position and relatively cheap
reviews.text: We didn't do breakfast there, so no comments on that.

description: The Cumberland Hotel is one of London's most famous and finest four star hotels. Opposite Marble Arch it is perfectly located with superb service and facilities even boasting a Michelin Star among it's many accolades. It's inspiring lobby exhibit's inspirational original works of modern art, perfectly complimenting it's contemporary style. A great hotel in a perfect location in one of the world's great cities!
